3.speaker: Player
3.text: A possibility that's kept me awake countless nights.

91.speaker: Wyll
91.text: A possibility that's kept me awake countless nights.

143.speaker: Wyll
143.text: But I don't have half a clue where to start, other than play her games, and play by the rules. That's the only language devils listen to.

85.speaker: Player
85.text: Why obey her at all? What's the worst she could do?

31.speaker: Wyll
31.text: She could kill me, for one - and that's not the worst of it.

57.speaker: Wyll
57.text: My contract is very clear I can bring Mizora no harm: she'll have to let me out of my pact willingly.

96.speaker: Wyll
96.text: The only way out is if I can out-bargain her. We're standing here with nothing but the clothes on our backs and the worms in our heads.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: We can beat her, if we put our worms together.

50.speaker: Wyll
50.text: We can, I'm sure of it. How glad I am that you see me as more than my patron's pet.

127.speaker: Player
127.text: I just fear what she will do to us next.

125.speaker: Wyll
125.text: I'm so sorry to give you another reason to sleep restlessly, but it's my burden to bear.

90.speaker: Wyll
90.text: She won't touch you, unless there's something there for her to take. Don't give her so much as an inkling there might be.

39.speaker: Player
39.text: We'll see if it's worth it. We might need the pact, after all.

99.speaker: Wyll
99.text: That has been its tragedy. I've saved so many with the talents of the Blade.

135.speaker: Wyll
135.text: Without the pact, I'm just a man. What good is my blade then, when it's too dull to split monsters? What good is a flame when a mere breath snuffs it out?

109.speaker: Player
109.text: Why obey her at all? What could she do that's worse than she already has?

62.speaker: Player
62.text: Can't we just attack her the next time she pops up?

33.speaker: Wyll
33.text: We can have all for it, but it won't so much as chip one of her nailed claws: She'll escape to the Hells. And if we succeeded, my life would be taken in exchange.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: I was a magistrate once, I could see if you missed any loopholes in your contract.

139.speaker: Wyll
139.text: There could well be: she has the blighted thing, what I know of it is simply what has engraved itself upon my memory.

116.speaker: Player
116.text: There must be some loophole in the contract that lets you out.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: I did the bidding of my abuser for so long, and it only made me weaker.

25.speaker: Wyll
25.text: You were exploited, you were bound. I was not.

81.speaker: Wyll
81.text: This was a path I chose, thinking I knew all the terms. I thought wrong.

26.speaker: Player
26.text: I didn't even have a pact, and I was captured by one for ten years.

44.speaker: Wyll
44.text: But you got out, you did the unimaginable. You brilliant, impossible woman.

113.speaker: Wyll
113.text: I wish I'd had a piece of your drive aeons ago, before I got years deep into blindly obeying Mizora.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Ah. The one little question that put me out of house and home.

64.speaker: Wyll
64.text: Ah. The one little question that put me out of house and home.

150.speaker: Wyll
150.text: I can't utter the terms or circumstances of the pact. I can tell you most all else - but the pact? I'm forbidden, unless Mizora permits it.

34.speaker: Wyll
34.text: But I'll say this: the moment I pacted myself to Mizora I have not regretted for a heartbeat. It was my proudest deed.

72.speaker: Wyll
72.text: It was worth the sacrifice. All I can give you on that is my solemn word.

54.speaker: Wyll
54.text: Gods damn her straight back to the Hells.

20.speaker: Wyll
20.text: Just look at me. I did what was right. And Mizora made me pay for it.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Mizora serves Zariel. The Archduchess of  the Hells. Why would  you sell your soul to her?

126.speaker: Karlach
126.text: Mizora serves Zariel. The Archduchess of  the Hells. Why would  you sell your soul to her?

138.speaker: Wyll
138.text: I'd be hunting devils and demons, Mizora said. Traitors and hypocrites - heartless evils of all sorts - but not...

27.speaker: Wyll
27.text: ... not people like you. I swear, I didn't know.

71.speaker: Player
71.text: *Warlock pacts tend to be unforgiving, from what you know of them. Wyll was lucky he didn't face a more severe punishment.*

146.speaker: Player
146.text: *Warlock pacts tend to be unforgiving, from what you know of them. Wyll was lucky he didn't face a more severe punishment.*

97.text: *Warlock pacts tend to be unforgiving, from what you know of them. Wyll was lucky he didn't face a more severe punishment.*

154.speaker: Narrator
154.text: *Warlock pacts tend to be unforgiving, from what you know of them. Wyll was lucky he didn't face a more severe punishment.*

112.speaker: Player
112.text: You warned me about Raphael, but are pacted to Mizora? What a fraud.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: An actual hero. One of the few.

130.speaker: Karlach
130.text: An actual hero. One of the few.

119.speaker: Player
119.text: Let me guess: This pact is what caused the rift between you and your father.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: Let me guess: This pact is what caused the rift between you and your father.

87.speaker: Wyll
87.text: It's... not unrelated. I wish I could tell you more.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: What are the terms of your pact?

22.speaker: Player
22.text: You should get out of this pact.

121.speaker: Player
121.text: How in the Hells did you get involved with Mizora?

56.speaker: Player
56.text: Half-truths and devil pacts? You're not worth the soil you stand on.

153.speaker: Player
153.text: The Blade of Frontiers has some explaining to do.

73.speaker: Player
73.text: What did you expect? She's a devil. Hardly the paragon of honesty.

86.speaker: Player
86.text: You've been turned into a devil. An appropriate punishment, I'd say.

148.speaker: Wyll
148.text: I bear the image of one, at least. But my heart is the same.

117.speaker: Player
117.text: You're lucky she didn't take your soul when she came.

111.speaker: Wyll
111.text: I'd count my lucky stars for it - but I reckon luck is on holiday. I'm only alive because my patron still has use for me.

136.speaker: Player
136.text: You're lucky she didn't take your soul when she came.

74.speaker: Player
74.text: I'd be hunting devils and demons, she said. Traitors and hypocrites - heartless evils of all sorts - but not...

51.speaker: Wyll
51.text: I'd be hunting devils and demons, she said. Traitors and hypocrites - heartless evils of all sorts - but not...

14.speaker: Wyll
14.text: ... not Zariel's victims, not innocent tieflings.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: Mizora's set me on fiends inside and outside the Hells. She's never ordered a rescue.

32.speaker: Wyll
32.text: Mizora's set me on fiends inside and outside the Hells. She's never ordered a rescue.

40.speaker: Wyll
40.text: Gods, she makes a mockery of everything the Blade stands for. Such an arsehole.
40.context: NodeContext: Subtly exasperated. Not leaning too far into anger or vexation.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: She'll be gone soon enough. Do this mission, and Mizora will free you from the pact.

142.speaker: Wyll
142.text: Thank you - for sticking your neck out for me. I mean it. But - I'm not going to celebrate 'til I'm actually free.

152.speaker: Wyll
152.text: I can already feel her scheming. She won't let me go without a fuss, trust me on this.

79.speaker: Player
79.text: It's not like you have a choice. Do the mission, or rot in the Hells.

59.speaker: Wyll
59.text: Not just rot. I'd have to fight.

8.speaker: Wyll
8.text: One of the mindless blobs clawing at demons on the front lines of the Blood War.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: A warrior? Hardly. A single lemure is worth less than a maggot. Only in swarms are they ever useful.

65.speaker: Lae'zel
65.text: A warrior? Hardly. A single lemure is worth less than a maggot. Only in swarms are they ever useful.

28.speaker: Shadowheart
28.text: Mizora certainly plays for keeps, anyway.
28.context: NodeContext: Wyll is talking about becoming a soldier for Zariel, which is very triggering for Karlach.

141.speaker: Astarion
141.text: My, my. She really has you by the unmentionables, doesn't she?
141.context: NodeContext: Wyll is talking about becoming a soldier for Zariel, which is very triggering for Karlach.

84.speaker: Gale
84.text: Were I a less considerate man, this is where I'd remind you of the importance of reading the fine print. But fear not - I shall bite my tongue.
84.context: NodeContext: Wyll is talking about becoming a soldier for Zariel, which is very triggering for Karlach.

118.speaker: Karlach
118.text: No, Wyll. Not you. I won't let that happen. Not ever.
118.context: NodeContext: Wyll is talking about becoming a soldier for Zariel, which is very triggering for Karlach.

16.speaker: Halsin
16.text: A cruel bind. Mizora is like a spider, and you the enwebbed fly.
16.context: NodeContext: Clears throat at end of line, he physically cannot finish.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: It's not going to happen. You mean too much to the Sword Coast.
30.context: NodeContext: Clears throat at end of line, he physically cannot finish.

123.speaker: Player
123.text: It's not going to happen. You mean too much to the Sword Coast.
123.context: NodeContext: Clears throat at end of line, he physically cannot finish.

5.speaker: Wyll
5.text: And it means everything to me.
5.context: NodeContext: Clears throat at end of line, he physically cannot finish.

52.speaker: Wyll
52.text: I always knew what my future held, and I know I chose right.
52.context: NodeContext: Clears throat at end of line, he physically cannot finish.

49.speaker: Wyll
49.text: Thank you - for sticking your neck out for me. I mean it.

93.speaker: Wyll
93.text: But - I'm not going to celebrate 'til I'm actually free. I can feel Mizora scheming, plotting.

80.speaker: Wyll
80.text: She won't let me go without making a fuss. Trust me on that.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: So you're bound to be a lemure, no matter what?

103.speaker: Wyll
103.text: Yes, unless Mizora actually fulfils her promise and sets me free.

23.speaker: Wyll
23.text: Yes, unless I find a way to free myself from my devil's talons.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: You are everything you accused Karlach of being. I'm not sorry for you.

102.speaker: Player
102.text: You are everything you accused me of being. I'm not sorry for you.

67.speaker: Jaheira
67.text: Eh. Knowing a devil's deal, you would retain your senses. No comfort, I suppose.
67.context: NodeContext: Wyll says if he fails his contract, he'll be turned into a 'mindless blob'. Jaheira is trying and failing to find the bright side.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I thought you were supposed to hunt devils. Doesn't this violate your contract?

63.speaker: Wyll
63.text: The same thought crossed my mind. I am only to hunt the infernal, the demonic, and the heartless.

98.speaker: Wyll
98.text: But nowhere was it stated that I can't help one.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: We need to get you out of this pact.

61.speaker: Wyll
61.text: You're right, of course. Somewhere, there must a weak link, a loophole, an exploit.

45.speaker: Wyll
45.text: Either we find it - or I'm made a mindless blob clawing at demons on the front lines of the Blood War.

100.speaker: Player
100.text: Any idea who this devil is that needs freeing?

43.speaker: Wyll
43.text: Not a one. All that matters is that we free it.

92.speaker: Wyll
92.text: Fail, and I'm made a mindless blob clawing at demons on the front lines of the Blood War.

110.speaker: Wyll
110.text: Damn it all, what have I done?

76.speaker: Wyll
76.text: I'd be hunting devils and demons, Mizora said. Traitors and hypocrites - heartless evils of all sorts - but not...

48.speaker: Wyll
48.text: ... not this. Not Zariel's victims, not innocent tieflings.

66.speaker: Wyll
66.text: Karlach showed us the truth. And I refused to see it.

145.speaker: Player
145.text: You warned me about Raphael, but are pacted to Mizora? What a fraud.

19.speaker: Wyll
19.text: I deserve that. Consider me properly shamed.

129.speaker: Player
129.text: Visions can't always be trusted. You did what you thought was right.

131.speaker: Player
131.text: The Blade of Frontiers has some explaining to do.

137.speaker: Wyll
137.text: I'll say what I can. But it won't be enough.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: What did you expect? She's a devil. Hardly the paragon of honesty.

11.speaker: Wyll
11.text: All these years, you'd think it's a lesson I'd have well learned.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Why didn't you tell me about Mizora before now?

120.speaker: Wyll
120.text: My oath forbids me from uttering her very name - not unless she's revealed herself to you.

2.speaker: Wyll
2.text: Though to hear her tell it, it was my choice to keep her a secret.

105.speaker: Wyll
105.text: It's Mizora who grants me the power to conjure armour and cast eldritch blasts.

18.speaker: Wyll
18.text: Before I was infected, I could even call hellbeasts and summon festering clouds.

122.speaker: Wyll
122.text: But I promise you, every thrust of my blade and every flame I sparked was for the good of the Coast.

36.speaker: Wyll
36.text: Or so I thought - until Karlach.

104.speaker: Player
104.text: Let me guess: This pact is what caused the rift between you and your father.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: What are the terms of the pact?
